activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8607
activity.text:
I think the time display and sorting feature according to the list will be good enough to start off with 

Ie: 
- A time display in patient card stating the time left for review or time over after missing a review.

- being able to sort the list according to the review. so that the line list would be showing the missed review first and then the review pending according to the time to next review.

Hope this is clear. later we could do a scoping of how it has to come out with the events module and specific reviews according to task and login types

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8425
activity.text: Ok. Is there an option to leave space for header

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8425
activity.text:
We also have an option to leave a space for a header according the the size of the paper. 
Eg - prescriptions will be small A5
Discharge will be A4. 
Bill will be small a5 or even smaller 
Lab might be different size and so on

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8425
activity.text:
Palliative care will definitely need for IAPC instance. 
@bodhish @aparnacoronasafe  - might need It in govt setting as well as some of the hospitals have their own logo and in some, they will have. LSG logo inaddition. - Logos can be the same as the profile picture of the facility so that they enter the logo of the facility if any at all

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7544
activity.text: Also I was thinking , we might need a stop date as well. So that we can ensure the symptoms are resolved. Not urgent, but on a the long run, it will give proper data and surety that the symptom is controlled.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7544
activity.text: adding date of onset selection for each symptom - not urgent

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7543
activity.text: search by typing in symptoms list

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7375
activity.text: This also comes as part of schedule H drugs. Psychiatric medications and all. We can't have it as dash board because we need to know which all patients are on that medication. Flagging is good in bringing focus on the patient on such medications but that alone might not address the need. Same thing happens with patients on immunosuppressants.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#2230
activity.text:
Hi guys. Didn't get the gist of the query. Is it regarding the dilution rate? 

Regarding giving a medicine diluted in a solvent. Usual injection medicines comes as vial (small glass bottle) or ampule ( small glass pellet). It will be of higher concentrations. At time we give it direct and others instances as diluted. 
The calculation is 
In a vial or a ampule contains __ ml of X Medicne which has the strength of __ mg 
Eg: 1 ampule of Morphine has 1 ml which has a strength of 10 mg 

This __ ml of X Medicne is diluted in __ ml of solvent ( NS/ RL/ Sterile water/ etc.). This will be give as __ ml bolus(single dose) or as infusion @__ ml/hr
